intro: Agoseris arizonica, commonly known as Arizona tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Agoseris arizonica is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
